criterias.name: Page load speed score
criterias.description:
Speed score as estimated by Google. 
    Google will compare your website load speed with millions of other websites in 
    their database. The score ranges from 0 to 100. The higher the value the better. 
    If the page is anywhere over 85 you site loads really fast.

criterias.name: Page load speed
criterias.description:
It's recommended to increase the webpage's
     load speed. Low load speed may decrease the number of users tolerant enough to wait
      till the website is loaded completely.

criterias.name: Page size
criterias.description:
It's recommended to reduce the website's
     100% loaded size. People prefer websites that load quickly and so do search
      engines counting it as a positive ranking factor.

criterias.name: Page load time
criterias.description:
It's recommended to reduce the page load
     time. If the website is loading for too long it will have a negative impact on
      the website's ranking.

criterias.name: Downloaded files and page elements
criterias.description: List of the loaded files and elements before the website is displayed.
